content:
Add an Event Listener to a FlexCard

Create the Custom or Pubsub event. To create the Custom event, see Trigger a Custom Event from an Action on a FlexCard. To create the Pubsub event, see Trigger a Pubsub Event from an Action on a FlexCard.

In the FlexCard Designer, click Setup to open the Setup panel.
In the Event Listener section, click + Add New.
Select a Custom or Pubsub Event Type.

To configure a Custom event:

*   In the Event Name field, enter the name of the event.
*   To register dynamic events based on a parent attribute or a session variable, use context variables such as {Parent.attr} (on a child FlexCard only), {recordId}, and {Session.var}.
*   Enter an event name such as event_{Parent.name} or evnt{Session.recordLimit}. See Register Dynamic Custom and Pubsub Events.

To configure a PubSub event:

*   In the Channel Name field, enter the channel in which the event is posted.
*   To register dynamic events based on a parent attribute or a session variable, use context variables such as {Parent.attr} (on a child FlexCard only) and {Session.var}.
*   Enter a channel name such as productViewCard_{recordId}. You must define the context variable in your FlexCard's datasource configuration to see expected results in Preview.

Beginning Winter '22, Channel Name supports registering dynamic events based on a parent attribute or a session variable. Beginning Spring '22, Channel Name and Event Name support registering dynamic events based on a parent attribute or a session variable.

In the Event Name field, enter the name of the event.

If your action type is Card, and type is remove, in the Record Index field, update the index to indicate which record to remove.

To create the action:

*   Select an Action Type from the dropdown. See FlexCards Actions Reference.
*   To configure the selected Action Type, see FlexCards Action Properties.
*   (Optional) Beginning Winter '22, to execute the action depending on the value of a data field, in the Conditions section, click + Add New. See Add Conditions to a FlexCard Element.
*   Click Save.
*   (Optional) Beginning Winter '22, execute sequential actions from an event listener. See Trigger Sequential Actions from an Event Listener on a FlexCard.

Let us know if this article solved your issue. Yes No
title: Add Event Listener to a FlexCard
